title: Apple could soon be adding per-website dark mode toggles in Safari
content:
Safari is one of the most commonly used web browsers on Apple devices. It’s fast, reliable, and efficient when it comes to energy usage. This web browser supports a wide variety of features that cater to basic needs. However, power users sometimes find it lacking when compared to its rivals, such as Google Chrome. In

The post Apple could soon be adding per-website dark mode toggles in Safari appeared first on xda-developers.
description: WebKit code reveals that Apple could be adding per-website dark mode toggles in Safari. It's unclear when and if the feature will roll out.
